required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: A pilot study that seeks to develop a set of typologies of users of mobile sleep tracking technologies, and optimal sleep health educational strategies among users of mobile wearable technologies that track sleep.

primary_outcome.measure: Sleep time measured by wearable mobile sleep tracking technology
primary_outcome.description: Mobile sleep tracking device will be worn by patient for 15 days and will measure sleep patterns in patients

primary_outcome.measure: Time in deep sleep measured by wearable mobile sleep tracking technology
primary_outcome.description: Mobile sleep tracking device will be worn by patient for 15 days and will measure sleep patterns in patients
24-item DBAS scale with five subscales corresponding to: (1) consequences of insomnia (2) control and predictability of sleep (3) sleep requirement expectations (5) sleep-promoting practices

primary_outcome.measure: Measure of motivation to change using the Change Assessment Scale (CAS)
primary_outcome.description: 8 scale measure divided into 4 separate scales: Scale 1: "Pre-Contemplation" Scale 2: "Contemplation" Scale 3 "Action" Scale 4 "Maintenance"

arm_group.description: Procedures will be delivered to users of the GAD, individuals who have opted in via their smartphone application, to receive messages about various areas of health.
For two weeks participants agree to receive sleep health messages and wear the GAD

intervention.description: Over the course of 2 weeks' participants will receive specialized sleep-related message interventions to encourage sleep awareness via the smartphone application.
Survey responses will be merged with objective GAD data (sleep time, time in deep sleep, physical activity) which will assist in developing message design formats for message testing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A current user of the OURA ring activity and sleep tracker device.
For Aim 3 MOST message testing, the inclusion criteria include the following:
- Health conscious.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non English speakers.

facility.name: New York University School of Medicine

patient_data.ipd_description: All of the individual participant data collected during the trial, after deidentification.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Immediately following publication. No end date
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Requests should be directed to Rebecca.robbins@nyulangone.org. To gain access, data requestors will need to sign a data access agreement
